gw.plugin.agencybill

Interface ICommissionOverride

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface ICommissionOverride
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    Plugin to determine whether to change the commission amount of an invoice item or leave it untouched and create a commission adjustment invoice item.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean shouldCreateCommissionAdjustmentInvoiceItem(InvoiceItem originalInvoiceItem, java.math.BigDecimal originalCommissionRate, java.math.BigDecimal newCommissionRate)
      Will be called during overriding of commission rate for the primary role in agency bill to decide whether to change the commission amount of an invoice item or leave it untouched and create a commission adjustment invoice item.

    • Method Detail

      • shouldCreateCommissionAdjustmentInvoiceItem

        boolean shouldCreateCommissionAdjustmentInvoiceItem(InvoiceItem originalInvoiceItem,
                                                  java.math.BigDecimal originalCommissionRate,
                                                  java.math.BigDecimal newCommissionRate)
        Will be called during overriding of commission rate for the primary role in agency bill to decide whether to change the commission amount of an invoice item or leave it untouched and create a commission adjustment invoice item.

        NOTE: This plugin method may be called multiple times per invoice item in certain scenarios. When a commission rate override is done for the Primary role on a charge, this plugin method will be called once for each invoice item of the charge that is not a reversal item or reversed item. In addition, this method will be called one additional time for each invoice item that has as its active item commission an item commission whose role is Primary and whose parent charge commission is NOT the default charge commission for the charge. So in this way this plugin method can potentially be called more than once per invoice item during an override of commission at the charge level.

        In reality we'd really only need for this to be called once per invoice item, but as an artifact of the way the processing is set up, you can end up having it called more than once per invoice item as explained above.

        Parameters:
        originalInvoiceItem - the item for which the commission will be overridden. This item will never be a reversal or reversed or a commissionRemainder item. It may be a commissionAdjustment item as well as a regular item.
        originalCommissionRate - the original (pre-override) commission rate
        newCommissionRate - the new overriding commission rate
        Returns:
        true if you want the invoice item to remain unchanged and an adjustment invoice item to be created. false if you want the original invoice item to be modified -- this may change invoice paid status.
